Generation I.Red: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
Generation I.Yellow: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in 7 colors.
Generation I.Stadium: When away from human eyes, its core is said to glow mysteriously in seven colors. This Pokémon may have come from outer space.

Generation II.Gold: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
Generation II.Silver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
Generation II.Crystal: It is said that it uses the seven-colored core of its body to send electric waves into outer space.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Starmie 's center section - the core - glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pok é mon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
Generation III.Sapphire: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pok é mon 's body glows in seven colors.
Generation III.Emerald: People in ancient times imagined that Starmie were transformed from the reflections of stars that twinkled on gentle waves at night.
Generation III.FireRed: This Pok é mon has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

Generation IV.Diamond: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation IV.Pearl: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation IV.Platinum: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.

Generation V.Black: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation V.White: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation V.Black 2: Its core shines in many colors and sends radio signals into space to communicate with something.
Generation V.White 2: Its core shines in many colors and sends radio signals into space to communicate with something.

Generation VI.X: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
Generation VI.Y: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Starmie's center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has been given the nickname "the gem of the sea."
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pokémon's body glows in seven colors.

Generation VII.Sun: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
Generation VII.Moon: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its sparkling core is called "the gem of the sea." This core can be made into high-priced accessories that are traded in secret.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
Generation VIII.Shield: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

Generation V.Black 2: Route 13 , Undella Town , Humilau City ( Surfing on rippling water )
Generation V.White 2: Route 13 , Undella Town , Humilau City ( Surfing on rippling water )
